dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Senate deputy Suindik Aldashev is pointing to a 237,000 ton aviation fuel deficit right now in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Senate deputy Suindik Aldashev is pointing to a two hundred thirty seven thousand ton aviation fuel deficit right now in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He stated that the current deficit is around 237,000 tons, and this figure is expected to grow to 550,000 tons by 2030.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he's saying that's expected to almost double by 2030, which is uh, pretty alarming for the aviation sector there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he's saying that's expected to almost double by twenty thirty, which is uh, pretty alarming for the aviation sector there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He stated that the current deficit is around 237,000 tons, and this figure is expected to grow to 550,000 tons by 2030.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the thing is, it's not just about production—the refineries can't meet demand, so they're relying on imports.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the thing is, it's not just about production-the refineries can't meet demand, so they're relying on imports.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Aldashev, the country's oil refineries are unable to meet growing demand, forcing Kazakhstan to rely on imported fuel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then you've got this closed market situation. He mentioned some airports actually profit from fuel sales and block competition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then you've got this closed market situation. He mentioned some airports actually profit from fuel sales and block competition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also noted that profits from aviation fuel sales make up a significant portion of income for certain airports. There are airports that are not interested in allowing other players access to fuel infrastructure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, which keeps prices high. Fuel makes up, what, like 36.5 percent of an airline ticket's cost?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, which keeps prices high. Fuel makes up, what, like thirty six point five percent of an airline ticket's cost?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fuel makes up 36.5 percent of the ticket price, aircraft maintenance accounts for 14.9 percent, airport services 10.7 percent, and passenger services 6.1 percent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and when you add maintenance and airport fees, it's no wonder fares are so expensive for people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and when you add maintenance and airport fees, it's no wonder fares are so expensive for people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And half the airports need urgent reconstruction? That's a huge infrastructure issue on top of everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And half the airports need urgent reconstruction? That's a huge infrastructure issue on top of everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Their infrastructure is worn out, equipment is outdated, and half of the country's airports require urgent reconstruction, Aldashev stated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like there's no real planning or unified strategy from the government to handle any of this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like there's no real planning or unified strategy from the government to handle any of this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unfortunately, there is currently no transparent mechanism for fuel sales and price formation, nor is there a unified government approach to regulating the issue. There is also a lack of systematic planning in airport development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So his proposal is about increasing domestic refinery output and creating a transparent system for fuel supply.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So his proposal is about increasing domestic refinery output and creating a transparent system for fuel supply.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To address the issue, the senator proposed developing an efficient and optimal management model for Kazakhstan's civil aviation sector, increasing production at domestic oil refineries, and establishing a unified and systematic approach to ensuring airlines are supplied with aviation fuel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus getting airports to focus on their core jobs and attract more investment into the sector. It's a full overhaul.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus getting airports to focus on their core jobs and attract more investment into the sector. It's a full overhaul.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Airports need to focus on their core operations and eliminate non-core activities. Efforts should be made to boost the investment appeal of the sector and create optimal mechanisms for attracting investors, he concluded.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But with local budgets funding loss-making airports, it's gonna be a tough shift without serious policy changes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But with local budgets funding loss-making airports, it's gonna be a tough shift without serious policy changes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many airports are funded by local budgets and operate at a loss.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's all connected—fuel, infrastructure, regulation…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's all connected-fuel, infrastructure, regulation...
